radiographic_examinations.findings: Normal coronary arteries but with a slow flow of contrast medium in the coronary bed and an aneurysm of the RCA.
radiographic_examinations.changes_over_time: In May 2004, the right CAA was significantly enlarged, while there was still no coronary stenosis and the flow in the coronary bed remained slow.

radiographic_examinations.findings: Complete disappearance of the aneurysm with the sinus node artery left in situ and a patent anastomosis of the right internal thoracic artery to the distal RCA.
